name: Nitrazepam
summary: A benzodiazepine hypnotic used primarily for the short-term treatment of insomnia and certain seizure disorders.
description: Nitrazepam is a long-acting benzodiazepine with sedative, anxiolytic, muscle relaxant, and anticonvulsant properties. It is primarily prescribed for the short-term management of insomnia, especially when difficulty in maintaining sleep is present. It has also been used in epilepsy treatment, particularly for certain pediatric seizure types, but is less common today due to safety concerns and tolerance development.

off_label_uses: Certain seizure disorders (e.g., myoclonic seizures, infantile spasms)

sections.text: Enhances the effect of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) at the GABA-A receptor, leading to increased chloride influx and neuronal hyperpolarization, producing sedative and anticonvulsant effects.

adult.insomnia: 5–10 mg at bedtime; lowest effective dose for shortest possible duration

sections.geriatric: Lower initial doses (e.g., 2.5–5 mg) to reduce fall and confusion risk
sections.pediatric: Specialist use only for seizure disorders

sections.text: Onset within 30–60 minutes; effects may last 6–8 hours or longer due to long half-life.

sections.black_box: Benzodiazepines can cause dependence, withdrawal, and potentially fatal respiratory depression when combined with opioids.
other: Limit use to short-term periods to reduce dependence risk

items: Signs of misuse, abuse, or dependence

sections.pregnancy: Avoid unless absolutely necessary; potential risk to fetus
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; avoid or monitor infant for sedation
sections.pediatrics: Use limited to specialist treatment of seizure disorders
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity; higher risk of falls and confusion

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over weeks to prevent withdrawal symptoms such as anxiety, insomnia rebound, tremors, and seizures.

items: Long half-life can lead to next-day sedation and impaired coordination
Use lowest effective dose for the shortest duration
